title: Amendment 1
description: Exempt local laws or local constitutional amendments from the budget isolation resolution process

title: Allow Franklin County Board of Education to Manage, Sell, or Lease Land in the Franklin County School System Amendment
description: Allow the Franklin County Board of Education to manage, sell, or lease lands or natural resources from the lands within in the Franklin County School System located in Walker and Fayette County

title: Minimum Wage Increase and Paid Sick Leave Initiative
description: Increase the minimum wage to $15 per hour and require employers to provide paid sick leave

title: Repeal Top-Four Ranked-Choice Voting Initiative
description: Repeal the top-four ranked-choice voting (RCV) system that was adopted in 2020

title: Proposition 133
description: Require partisan primary elections for partisan offices

title: Proposition 134
description: Create a signature distribution requirement for citizen-initiated ballot measures based on state legislative districts

title: Proposition 135
description: Provide for the legislature to terminate a state of emergency or alter the emergency powers of the governor during the state of emergency, and provide for any emergency powers granted to the governor to automatically terminate 30 days after the state of emergency is proclaimed, unless the state legislature extends the emergency powers granted to the governor, and except in cases for a state of war emergency or an emergency arising from a flood or a fire

title: Proposition 136
description: Provide for challenges to an initiative measure or constitutional amendment after the filing of the measure with the secretary of state

title: Proposition 137
description: End term limits for state supreme court justices and superior court judges, replacing them with terms of good behavior, unless decided otherwise by a judicial review commission, and would end retention elections at the end of the judicial term, providing for retention elections under certain circumstances

title: Proposition 138
description: Allow for tipped workers to be paid 25% less per hour than the minimum wage if any tips received by the employee were not less than the minimum wage plus $2 for all hours worked

title: Proposition 139
description: Establish a state constitutional right to abortion

title: Proposition 311
description: Establish a $20 fee on every conviction for a criminal offense, which would go to pay a benefit of $250,000 to the family of a first responder who is killed in the line of duty

title: Proposition 312
description: Allow for property owners to apply for a property tax refund in certain circumstances, including in instances if the city or locality in which the property is located does not enforce laws regarding illegal camping, loitering, obstructing public thoroughfares, panhandling, public urination or defecation, public consumption of alcoholic beverages, and possession or use of illegal substances

title: Proposition 313
description: Provide for life imprisonment for an individual who is convicted of sex trafficking of a child

title: Proposition 314
description: Allow for state and local police to arrest noncitizens who cross the border unlawfully, allow for state judges to order deportations, require the use of the e-verify program for some public governmental programs and employment eligibility purposes, and make the sale of fentanyl a Class 2 felony if a person knowingly sells fentanyl resulting in the death of another person

title: Proposition 315
description: Prohibit a proposed rule from becoming effective if that rule is estimated to increase regulatory costs by more than $500,000 within five years after implementation, until the legislature enacts legislation ratifying the proposed rule

title: Countywide Voter Approval for New Casino Licenses and Repeal Casino Licenses in Pope County Initiative
description: Repeal the authorization for a casino license in Pope County and require countywide voter approval for any new casino licenses

title: Lottery Proceed Funding for Vocational-Technical School Scholarships and Grants Amendment
description: Allow proceeds from the state lottery to fund scholarships and grants for vocational-technical schools and technical institutes

title: Proposition 1
description: Change the Mental Health Services Act to Behavioral Health Services Act and issue bonds for veteran housing and housing for homeless persons

title: Proposition 2
description: Issue $10 billion in bonds to fund construction and modernization of public education facilities

title: Proposition 32
description: Increase minimum wage to $18 an hour

title: Proposition 33
description: Repeals Costa Hawkins Rental Housing Act

title: Proposition 34
description: Requires health care providers to spend 98% of revenues from federal discount prescription drug program on direct patient care

title: Proposition 35
description: Permanently authorizes a tax on managed care organizations to fund Medi-Cal programs

title: Proposition 36
description: Increase drug crime and theft penalties and allow a new class of crime to be called treatment-mandated felony, which gives the offender the option to participate in drug and mental health treatment

title: Proposition 3
description: Repeal Proposition 8 and establish a right to marry

title: Proposition 4
description: Issue $10 billion in bonds to fund state and local parks, environmental protection projects, water infrastructure projects, energy projects, and flood protection projects

title: Proposition 5
description: Lower the vote threshold from 66.67% to 55% for local bond measures to fund housing projects and public infrastructure

title: Proposition 6
description: Remove involuntary servitude as punishment for a crime from the state constitution

title: Excise Tax on Firearms Dealers, Manufacturers, and Ammunition Vendors Measure
description: Levy a 6.5% excise tax on firearms and ammunition manufacturing and sales to be imposed on firearms dealers, manufacturers, and ammunition vendors and appropriating the revenue to the Firearms and Ammunition Excise Tax Cash Fund to be used to fund crime victim services programs, education programs, and mental and behavioral health programs for children and veterans

title: Independent Judicial Discipline Adjudicative Board Amendment
description: Creates an independent judicial discipline adjudicative board and create rules for the judicial discipline process

title: Initiative and Referendum Filing and Judicial Retention Filing Deadlines Amendment
description: Change deadlines for filing initiative and referendum petition signatures and judicial retention notice deadlines to remove one week in order to allow one extra week for the secretary of state to certify ballot order and content and election officials' deadline to transmit ballots

title: Prohibit Hunting of Mountain Lion, Bobcat, and Lynx Initiative
description: Prohibit trophy hunting, defined as "intentionally killing, wounding, pursuing, or entrapping a mountain lion, bobcat, or lynx; or discharging or releasing any deadly weapon at a mountain lion, bobcat, or lynx"

title: Property Tax Exemption for Veterans with Individual Unemployability Status Amendment
description: Expands the property tax exemption for veterans with a disability to veterans with individual unemployability status

title: Property Tax Revenue Cap Initiative
description: Cap the property tax revenue to 4% growth above the total statewide property tax revenue collected in the previous year and require statewide voter approval to retain revenue above the cap

title: Remove Constitutional Same-Sex Marriage Ban Amendment
description: Remove the provision of the state constitution that says "Only a union of one man and one woman shall be valid or recognized as a marriage in this state"

title: Remove Right to Bail in First Degree Murder Cases Amendment
description: Remove the right to bail in cases of first degree murder when the proof is evident or the presumption is great

title: Retain Sports Betting Tax Revenue for Water Projects Measure
description: Allow the state to retain tax revenue collected above $29 million annually from the tax on sports betting proceeds

title: Right to Abortion and Health Insurance Coverage Initiative
description: Create a right to abortion in the state constitution and repeal constitutional provision banning the use of public funds for abortion

title: Amendment 1
description: Changes school board elections from nonpartisan to partisan beginning in the November 2026 general election and for primary elections nominating party candidates for the 2026 election

title: Amendment 2
description: Establishes a state constitutional right to hunt and fish

title: Amendment 3
description: Legalize marijuana for adults 21 years old and older

title: Amendment 4
description: Provide a state constitutional right to abortion before fetal viability

title: Amendment 5
description: Provide for an annual inflation adjustment for the value of the homestead property tax exemption

title: Amendment 6
description: Repeal a constitutional provision providing for public campaign financing for candidates who agree to spending limits

title: Judicial Appointments and Confirmations Amendment
description: Change the process for appointing and confirming district court judges to be the same as that used for supreme court justices and other higher court judges

title: Remove Legislature Authority to Limit Marriage to Opposite-Sex Couples Amendment
description: Remove provision of the constitution saying that "the legislature shall have the power to reserve marriage to opposite-sex couples"

title: Citizenship Voting Requirement for Voting Amendment
description: Amend the Idaho Constitution to provide that only a citizen of the United States can vote in the state

title: Top-Four Ranked-Choice Voting Initiative
description: Replace partisan primaries with open top-four primaries for the U.S. Senate, the U.S. House of Representatives, state legislature, elective state office, and county elective office; and establish ranked-choice voting for general elections, in which voters would rank the candidates

title: Assisted Reproductive Healthcare Advisory Question
description: Advise state officials on whether to provide for medically assisted reproductive treatments, including in vitro fertilization, to be covered by any health insurance plan in Illinois that provides full coverage to pregnancy benefits

title: Income Tax Advisory Question
description: Advise state officials on whether to amend the Illinois Constitution to create an additional 3% tax on income greater than $1 million for the purpose of dedicating funds to property tax relief

title: Penalties for Candidate Interference with Election Worker's Duties Advisory Question
description: Advise state officials on whether to establish civil penalties if a candidate interferes or attempts to interfere with an election worker's official duties

title: Allow State Funding for Non-Public Education Amendment
description: Allow the state to provide funding for non-public education

title: Citizenship Requirement for Voting Amendment
description: Require U.S. citizenship to be able to vote in the state

title: Outer Continental Shelf Revenues for Coastal Protection and Restoration Fund Amendment
description: Require federal revenues received by the state from energy production (including wind, solar, tidal, wave, and other alternative or renewable energy sources) to be deposited in the Coastal Protection and Restoration Fund

title: 48-Hour Waiting Period for Concurrence on Appropriation Bills Amendment
description: Prohibit the consideration of a conference committee report or senate amendments on an appropriations bill until 48 hours after the bill and a summary of the proposed changes is distributed to all legislators

title: Allow Legislature to Extend Regular Sessions to Pass Appropriations Bills Amendment
description: Allow the state legislature to extend its regular session by two-day increments, up to a maximum of six days, in order to pass a bill appropriating money

title: Judiciary Commission Investigation of Sitting Judges Amendment
description: Increase the membership of the judiciary commission by five members; adds "malfeasance while in office" to the list of specific actions that the supreme court can pursue disciplinary action against a judge; provides that the judiciary commission is responsible for investigating and recommending disciplinary actions

title: Property Tax Sales Administration Amendment
description: Provides for the administration of property tax sales

title: Question 1
description: Limit the amount of campaign contributions to $5,000 from individuals and entities to political action committees that make independent expenditures

title: Question 2
description: Authorize $25 million in general obligation bonds for research, development, and commercialization of for Maine-based public and private institutions in support of technological innovation

title: Question 3
description: Authorize $10 million in general obligation bonds for the restoration of local community buildings

title: Question 4
description: Authorize $30 million in general obligation bonds for the development and maintenance of outdoor trails

title: Question 5
description: Replace the Maine state flag with a flag consisting of a pine tree and the North Star on a buff background

title: Right to Reproductive Freedom Amendment
description: Establishes a right to reproductive freedom in the state constitution

title: Question 1
description: Authorize the state auditor to audit the state legislature, and remove some existing regulations regarding the auditing process

title: Question 2
description: Repeal the requirement that students must achieve a certain competency level on the Massachusetts Comprehensive Assessment System (MCAS) exam to graduate high school

title: Question 3
description: Provide for unionizing and collective bargaining for transportation network drivers

title: Question 4
description: Regulate access to psychedelic substances

title: Question 5
description: Gradually increase the wage of tipped employees until it meets the state minimum wage in 2029 and still permit tipping in addition to the minimum wage

title: Environment and Natural Resources Fund Amendment
description: Extend the dedication of lottery-derived revenue to Environment and Natural Resources Fund for 25 years

title: Amendment 1
description: Allow childcare establishments to be exempt from property tax

title: Amendment 4
description: Allow the Legislature to pass a law requiring Kansas City to increase funding for the Kansas City Police Department

title: Levying of Fees to Support Salaries of Law Enforcement Personnel Amendment
description: Define the administration of justice to include the levying of costs and fees to support the salaries and benefits for law enforcement personnel

title: Require Citizenship to Vote and Prohibit Ranked-Choice Voting Amendment
description: Establishes that only citizens who are Missouri residents can vote and prohibits ranked-choice voting

title: Question 1
description: Remove the constitutional status of the Board of Regents—which governs, controls, and manages the state universities in Nevada—thereby allowing the state legislature to review and change the governing organization of state universities

title: Question 2
description: Revise language in the state constitution related to public entities that benefit individuals with mental illness, blindness, or deafness

title: Question 3
description: Provide for open top-five primaries and ranked-choice voting for general elections

title: Question 4
description: Repeal language from the Nevada Constitution that allows the use of slavery and involuntary servitude as criminal punishments

title: Question 5
description: Amend the Sales and Use Tax of 1955 to provide a sales tax exemption for child and adult diapers

title: Right to Abortion Initiative
description: Provide for a state constitutional right to an abortion, providing for the state to regulate abortion after fetal viability

title: Voter Identification Initiative
description: Require that Nevada residents present a form of photo identification to verify their identity while voting in person, or to verify their identity using the last four digits of their drivers license or social security number when voting by mail

title: Increase Mandatory Judicial Retirement Age Amendment
description: Increase the mandatory judicial retirement age from 70 to 75

title: County Officer Salaries Amendment
description: Authorize the board of county commissioners to set salaries for county officers and clarify that fees collected by the county are to be deposited into the county treasury

title: Disabled Veteran Property Tax Exemption Amendment
description: Proportionally applies the disabled veteran property tax exemption according to a veteran's disability rating

title: Increase Veteran Property Tax Exemption Amendment
description: Increases the property tax exemption for veterans from $4,000 to $10,000, adjusted annually for inflation

title: Judicial Nominating Commission Amendment
description: Authorize the designee of the dean of the University of New Mexico Law School serve as chair of the judicial nomination commission

title: Public Education Bond Issue
description: Issues $230,258,400 in bonds to fund public higher education institutions, special public schools, and tribal schools

title: Public Libraries Bond Issue
description: Issues $19,305,000 in bonds to fund public libraries

title: Public Safety Radio Communications Systems Bond Issue
description: Issues $10,297,100 in bonds to modernize public safety radio communications systems

title: Senior Citizens Facilities Bond Issue
description: Issues $30,758,100 in bonds to fund senior citizens facilities

title: Equal Protection of Law Amendment
description: Provide that people cannot be denied rights based on their "ethnicity, national origin, age, and disability" or "sex, including sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, pregnancy outcomes, and reproductive healthcare and autonomy"
subject: Abortion;Constitutional rights;Race and ethnicity

title: Citizenship Requirement for Voting Amendment
description: Provide in the state constitution that only a citizen (rather than every citizen) of the U.S. may vote

title: Initiated Measure 1
description: Set an age limit for election or appointment to the U.S. Congress

title: Constitutional Measure 1
description: Update language used in the state constitution to describe certain state institutions such as changing "insane" to "individuals with mental illness", "feebleminded" to "individuals with developmental disabilities", and "deaf and dumb" to "deaf and hard of hearing"

title: Constitutional Measure 2
description: Establish a single-subject rule for initiatives; increase the signature requirement for constitutional initiatives; and require constitutional initiatives to be approved at two elections

title: Constitutional Measure 3
description: Change requirements for transfers from the state legacy fund, a fund that receives 30% of tax revenue from oil and gas production

title: Marijuana Legalization Initiative
description: Legalize recreational marijuana, allowing individuals to possess up to 1 oz of marijuana, 4g of concentrate, 300mg of edibles; and allowing individuals to grow three plants with a limit of six plants per household

title: Prohibit Property Taxes Initiative
description: Prohibit property taxes in the state except for those designed to pay for bonded indebtedness

title: Establish the Citizens Redistricting Commission Initiative
description: Establish the Ohio Citizens Redistricting Commission (CRC), a 15-member non-politician commission responsible for adopting state legislative and congressional redistricting plans

title: Citizenship Requirement for Voting Amendment
description: Provide in the state constitution that only a citizen (rather than every citizen) of the U.S. may vote

title: Public Infrastructure Districts Amendment
description: Allow municipalities to create public infrastructure districts  when all property owners within the proposed district sign a petition and give public infrastructure districts the authority to issue bonds for public improvements if approved by voters within the district

title: Measure 115
description: Allow the Legislature to impeach elected state executives

title: Measure 116
description: Establish the Independent Public Service Compensation Commission to determine certain public officials' salaries

title: Measure 117
description: Establish ranked-choice voting for federal and state offices

title: Measure 118
description: Require Oregon issue rebates to residents from surplus corporate tax revenue

title: Measure 119
description: Require cannabis businesses to submit to the Oregon Liquor and Cannabis Commission a signed labor peace agreement between the business and a labor organization with its licensure or renewal application

title: Cultural Arts and Economy Grant Program Bond Measure
description: Issue $10 million in bonds for funding for 1:1 matching grants to continue the Cultural Arts and Economy Grant program administered by the Rhode Island state council on the arts, and for improvements and renovations to the Tomaquag Museum, the Newport Contemporary Ballet, and the Trinity Repertory Company

title: Environmental and Recreational Infrastructure Bond Measure
description: Issue $53 million in bonds for environmental-related infrastructure, local recreation projects, and for preservation of land

title: Higher Education Facilities Bond Measure
description: Issue $160.5 million in bonds for improvements to higher education facilities, with $87.5 million going to the construction of a University of Rhode Island Biomedical Sciences building, and $73 million going to renovations and improvements to the Rhode Island College Institute of Cybersecurity & Emerging Technologies.

title: Housing Acquisition, Development, and Infrastructure Bond Measure
description: Issue $120 million in bonds to increase the availability of housing in the state

title: Question 1
description: Call for a state constitutional convention to be held

title: Citizenship Requirement for Voting Amendment
description: Provide in the state constitution that only a citizen (rather than every citizen) of the U.S. may vote

title: Constitutional Amendment E
description: Amend the constitution to change male pronouns in the Constitution to gender-neutral terms or titles

title: Constitutional Amendment F
description: Amend the South Dakota Constitution to provide that the state "may impose a work requirement on any person ... who has not been diagnosed as being physically or mentally disabled" for eligible individuals to receive Medicaid under the Medicaid expansion that took effect on July 1, 2023

title: Constitutional Amendment G
description: Provide a state constitutional right to abortion with a trimester framework for regulations

title: Constitutional Amendment H
description: Provide for top-two primary elections for the offices of governor, state legislative office, county office, the United States Senate, or the United States House of Representatives

title: Initiated Measure 28
description: Prohibit state sales taxes on anything sold for human consumption, not including alcoholic beverages or prepared food

title: Initiated Measure 29
description: Legalize the recreational use, possession, and distribution of marijuana

title: Regulation of Carbon Dioxide Pipelines Referendum
description: Uphold or repeal Senate Bill 201, a law that provides statutory requirements for regulating carbon dioxide pipelines and other transmission facilities, and allows counties to impose a surcharge on certain pipeline companies

title: Property Tax Exemption for Veterans and Surviving Spouses Amendment
description: Amend language in the Virginia Constitution regarding property tax exemptions for veterans and surviving spouses to say died in the line of duty rather than killed in action

title: Initiative 2066
description: Prohibit state and local governments from restricting access to natural gas

title: Initiative 2109
description: Repeal the capital gains excise tax imposed on long-term capital assets by individuals with capital gains over $250,000

title: Initiative 2117
description: Prohibit carbon tax credit trading and repeal provisions of the 2021 Washington Climate Commitment Act (CCA), a state law that provided for a cap and invest program designed to reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by 95% by 2050

title: Initiative 2124
description: Allow all employees and self-employed individuals to opt out of paying the tax and receiving benefits under WA Cares, the state's long-term services and supports trust health care program

title: Amendment 1
description: Prohibit people from participating in "the practice of medically assisted suicide, euthanasia, or mercy killing of a person"

title: Question 1
description: Prohibit any level of government in the state from applying or accepting non-governmental funds or equipment for election administration
subject: Administration;Elections

title: Question 2
description: Provide that only election officials designated by law may administer elections
subject: Elections

title: Question 1
description: Prohibit the legislature from delegating its power to appropriate money
subject: State legislatures

title: Question 2
description: Require legislative approval before the governor can expend federal money appropriated to the state
subject: Administration;State legislatures;Budgets

title: Citizenship Voting Requirement Amendment
description: States in the state Constitution that only U.S. citizens who are 18 years old or older can vote in federal, state, local, or school elections
subject: Suffrage

title: Initiative 83
description: Establishes semi-open primaries and ranked-choice voting for district elections
subject: Elections and campaigns

title: Statehood, Independence, or Free Association Referendum
description: Asks voters to choose an option for Puerto Rico's political status: statehood, independence, or sovereignty in free association with the U.S.
